OpenCDX 0.0.20240315130314 API

OpenCDx System Overview

OpenCDx provides an open framework, specification, and set of developer tools – including client libraries, Software Development Kits (SDKs), and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) – to accelerate development and adoption of interoperable, standards-based CDx applications that can be leveraged for a wide variety of public and private sector use cases.

Key Services

  • OpenCDx-Admin: This is the admin portal for OpenCDx. Developed using Spring Admin Server, it provides backend monitoring capabilities specifically for the OpenCDx environment.
  • OpenCDx-ANF: ANF aims to enhance data structure within HL7 v2 messages for more effective data analysis. It involves categorization of data into logical segments based on their interrelationships and usage frequency. This allows for better understanding, data manipulation, and ease of analysis.
  • OpenCDx-Audit: This module records key actions performed by individual users, systems, or services on OpenCDx. It creates audit records for every service invocation and user interaction on the platform.
  • OpenCDx-Classification: TODO: Description to be added.
  • OpenCDx-Client: A Spring library used to provide gRPC clients for necessary inter-service communication.
  • OpenCDx-Commons: This is a common library for OpenCDx aiming to reduce code redundancy and centralize common components.
  • OpenCDx-Communications: This module provides functional capabilities for any organization on the OpenCDx platform to send necessary operation messages and notifications.
  • OpenCDx-Config: This class encapsulates the OpenCDX Configuration server, and it distributes configuration information to all related OpenCDX Microservices to ensure proper functioning.
  • OpenCDx-ConnectedTest: This module enables OpenCDx to provide organizations on the platform with capabilities to create and manage Test Kits for patients.
  • OpenCDx-Dashboard: TODO: Description to be added.
  • OpenCDx-Discovery: This is the OpenCDX Discovery server, based on Spring Discovery Server and Eureka, it manages instances of microservices, with services provided through configuration.
  • OpenCDx-Gateway: Built on the Spring Gateway, OpenCDX Gateway efficiently routes REST and gRPC requests to the appropriate microservices.
  • OpenCDx-IAM: The IAM module oversees secure access control to essential resources and services provided by OpenCDx.
  • OpenCDx-Media: This module provides API functionality to enable uploads and downloads of media files like images, videos, PDFs, text documents, and spreadsheets to the OpenCDx platform.
  • OpenCDx-Predictor: TODO: Description to be added.
  • OpenCDx-Protector: TODO: Description to be added.
  • OpenCDx-Questionnaire: This module enables OpenCDx to provide organizations on the platform with capabilities to create and manage questionnaires and recommendations for patients as part of a Clinical Protocol.
  • OpenCDx-Routine: TODO: Description to be added.
  • OpenCDx-Shipping: OpenCDX Shipping microservice, responsible for taking oreders, and interacting with shipping vendors. .
  • OpenCDx-Tinkar: OpenCDx employs the standards-based Terminology Knowledge Architecture (TINKAR) specification for storage of medical concepts, thus enabling the platform to manage terminology generated by various stakeholders across the platform and related ecosystem.

Benefits

  • Connected Diagnostics: Facilitating standards-based diagnostic data capture, harmonization, and transmission between disparate systems within the existing healthcare ecosystem.
  • Community Focused: Remote and connected diagnostics adoption throughout the healthcare industry in an effort to support public health and national security interests.

Target Audience

OpenCDX is ideal for:

  • HHS
  • FDA
Packages
Package
Description
cdx.opencdx.admin
This is the OpenCDX Admin portal, developed using the Spring Admin Server, which provides backend monitoring capabilities for the OpenCDX environment.
cdx.opencdx.admin.config
These are the configuration settings used for OpenCDX Admin.
cdx.opencdx.anf
This microservice is responsible for persisting Alternate Normal Form (ANF) statements.
cdx.opencdx.anf.config
This is the principal configuration file for Spring.
cdx.opencdx.anf.controller
This package is dedicated to the maintenance of the REST and gRPC API controllers.
cdx.opencdx.anf.model
This package is dedicated to the management of Database Models leveraging Hibernate.
cdx.opencdx.anf.repository
This package is dedicated to housing Hibernate-based repositories or Data Access Objects (DAOs).
cdx.opencdx.anf.security
The purpose of this package is to encompass security-related configurations for Spring Security.
cdx.opencdx.anf.service
This is the Service Interface package, designed specifically for defining Spring service interfaces.
cdx.opencdx.anf.service.impl
This package is dedicated to the concrete implementation of Spring Service Interfaces.
cdx.opencdx.audit
The OpenCDX-Audit service performs the following key functions: It notes the creation, alteration, access, and removal of PII/PHI records. It logs modifications to a user's access controls. It tracks alterations to the configuration of OpenCDX.

This is the principal configuration file for Spring.
